page.title: 04TRADE
page.content: {AGRICULTURAL IMPLEMENT DEALER-MARTON The firm which has been run by five generations of the same family has grown and developed with the needs of mainly local farmers. It is one of ten similar establishments in Cheshire. The firm supplies and services all types of agricultural machinery, including tractors as well as selling garden equipment and clothing. They also repair farm implements and run a hire service. Eight people are employed at the depot,two of them in an administrative capacity. Pay, on average, is Â£100 per week. Business is steady, if not brisk with about 20 customers per day. The business is expanding (a new show room is to be built) partly as a result of stricter safety regulations on farms, meaning better maintenance of equipment.Exports are now common.
